com.camerontec.catalys.server.ha.communications

Interface IChannel

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DistributedCollectionRegistry

    public interface IChannel
    Interface to be implemented by classes capable of providing communications with other members of an HA group.

    Each channel is bound to a logical Topic which defines its scope of delivery to listeners within the HA group.

    Channels are obtained and subscriptions created via a IChannelFactory only.

    See Also:
    IChannelFactory

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Topic getTopic()
      Return the topic associated with this channel.
      Future<?> publish(ChannelMessage message)
      Publish a message to all subscribers of this channel's topic within the entire HA cluster.
      Future<?> publishToLocateSite(ChannelMessage message)
      Publish a message to all subscribers of this channel's topic attempting to limit the scope of delivery to the local cluster site.
      Future<?> send(SocketEndpoint destination, ChannelMessage message)
      Send a message to a specific subscriber in the HA group.

    • Method Detail

      • getTopic

        Topic getTopic()
        Return the topic associated with this channel.
        Returns:
        The channel topic.

      • publish

        Future<?> publish(ChannelMessage message)
        Publish a message to all subscribers of this channel's topic within the entire HA cluster.

        The means of publishing the message is not defined here. The underlying implementation decides whether the message is sent on individual point to point connections or via multicast.

        Parameters:
        message - The message to publish.
        Returns:
        A future indicating the result of publishing the message. Clients may choose to wait for completion of the future, which indicates that from the perspective of this node the message was sent to all intended recipients. An exception indicates that the message was not sent to at least one intended recipient.
        Throws:
        ChannelException - On error sending the message on any channel. Note that absence of such an exception is not a guarantee that the message was received by all intended recipients. It is recommended that an application protocol is used when guaranteed delivery is required.

      • publishToLocateSite

        Future<?> publishToLocateSite(ChannelMessage message)
        Publish a message to all subscribers of this channel's topic attempting to limit the scope of delivery to the local cluster site.

        The means of publishing the message is not defined here. The underlying implementation decides whether the message is sent on individual point to point connections or via multicast. However, the implementation must guarantee that when the message is delivered point to point is only received by local cluster nodes.

        Note: If the cluster is configured to use multicast, and this message is suitable for multicast, then multicast is the chosen delivery method. In that scenario the application cannot necessarily limit the receipt of this messages to local cluster nodes. That is, receipt of multicast messages is determined by network topology and the configured multicast TTL.

        Parameters:
        message - The message to publish.
        Returns:
        A future indicating the result of publishing the message. Clients may choose to wait for completion of the future, which indicates that from the perspective of this node the message was sent to all intended recipients. An exception indicates that the message was not sent to at least one intended recipient.
        Throws:
        ChannelException - On error sending the message on any channel. Note that absence of such an exception is not a guarantee that the message was received by all intended recipients. It is recommended that an application protocol is used when guaranteed delivery is required.

      • send

        Future<?> send(SocketEndpoint destination,
               ChannelMessage message)
        Send a message to a specific subscriber in the HA group.

        The application must guarantee to send the message to only the intended recipient which means that is must be send point to point.

        Parameters:
        destination - The destination subscriber.
        message - The message to send.
        Returns:
        A future indicating the result of sending the message. Clients may choose to wait for completion of the future, which indicates that from the perspective of this node the message was sent to the intended recipient. An exception indicates that the message was not sent to the intended recipient.
        Throws:
        ChannelException - On error sending the message. Note that absence of such an exception is not a guarantee that the message was received by the intended recipient. It is recommended that an application protocol (in this case request/response) is used when guaranteed delivery is required.
